abstract: British agency PRS for Music announces it is suing music-streaming website SoundCloud for copyright infringement; PRS, which represents more than 100,000 British songwriters and music publishers, claims Soundcloud has failed to obtain licenses and pay royalties.
lead_paragraph: PRS for Music, an agency that represents more than 100,000 songwriters and publishers, claims the streaming service has failed to obtain licenses and pay royalties.

headline.main: SoundCloud Sued for Copyright Infringement by PRS for Music
headline.print_headline: British Agency Sues SoundCloud, a Streaming Service, in Copyright Infringement

snippet: PRS for Music, an agency that represents more than 100,000 songwriters and publishers, claims the streaming service has failed to obtain licenses and pay royalties.
